intro: Stachytarpheta brevibracteata, commonly known as the narrow-bract blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, narrow, and lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant flower clusters and ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in landscaping for its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
